alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Arthur, south central Cherry, southeastern Grant, northeastern Keith, Hooker, northwestern Lincoln, McPherson and southwestern Thomas Counties through 830 PM CDT/730 PM MDT/... At 745 PM CDT/645 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mullen to 14 miles northeast of Keystone. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Tryon, Seneca, Swan Lake, Carr Lake, Lena, Flatts, Big Lamunyon Flats, Calora, East Cody Lake, Big Bald Hill, Bucktail Lake, Sand Beach Lake, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Three Mile Lake, Diamond Bar Lake, Bucktail, Sevenmile Hill, Schnick Lake and Hecla. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 167 and 203. Highway 92 between mile markers 169 and 206. Highway 97 between mile markers 32 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for southwestern, north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
